meanings.definition: The positive aspects or advantages of a situation.
meanings.sent1: One of the plusses of living in a small town is the sense of community.
meanings.sent2: She always focuses on the plusses of any challenge she faces.
meanings.sent3: Finding a parking spot right in front of the store was a real plus.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter was a plus in lifting everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The plusses of regular exercise include improved health and mood.

meanings.definition: The addition or positive sign in mathematics.
meanings.sent1: In math, we use plusses to show addition.
meanings.sent2: The plusses and minuses in the equation need to be balanced.
meanings.sent3: The student's eyes widened when she saw the plusses in the multiplication table.
meanings.sent4: The plusses on the graph indicated the increasing trend.
meanings.sent5: The plusses in the formula represent the values to be added together.

meanings.definition: To add something positive or beneficial to a situation.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to plusses up the atmosphere with her jokes.
meanings.sent2: Adding fresh flowers to the room really plusses it up.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to plusses up the boring meeting with music was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The chef decided to plusses up the dish with a sprinkle of herbs.
meanings.sent5: A little bit of creativity can really plusses up any project.
